Reviews.Title: “An absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: PhilAndAndy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early July on a short city break. It is not, as other reviewers have pointed out, the most glamorous or luxurious or cutting-edge hotel in the wonderful city of Madrid, but it is clean, well-maintained, quiet (very unusual for this city!), and is a real bargain. We booked in advance (in May) through the central Husa website, and got the room for just under £70 per night, and for that price it is outstanding. If it is your first visit to the city, you might prefer to stay closer to the best-known tourist locations, but we have been to Madrid frequently, and this was a great place to be based, amid the shops and cafes of the upmarket Salamanca district, with a Metro station five minutes walk away, buses and cab ranks close by, and a relaxed, lesiurely stroll to the centre of the city. The room was a good size, the bathroom excellent, particularly good wifi internet connection, and the beds guaranteed a good night's sleep. Perhaps a small armchair would have made the room more comfortable, and some visitors might lament the lack of any non-Spanish TV channels. Staff were always helpful at the front desk, and the daily cleaning of the room was particularly thorough and efficient. Cannot comment on the breakfasts as we paid a room-only rate and used the numerous local cafes (Le Pain Quotidien is especially good). We have stayed in fancier Madrid hotels, but we have never stayed in one which offered such quality at such a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location! Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: PatrickS454
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really lovely. Super value, location, cleanliness, and free wi-fi  service. The staff couldn't have been more helpful . Highly recommended !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not convinced”
Reviews.Author: Tuer
Reviews.Content: This is quite an old hotel which needs some changes. Rooms are very small and noisy! and not very clean, to be honest. It's true location is quite good and prices are very competitive but if you can afford a better place, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: kate w
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our honey moon around Spain. In Madrid we spent a week, where we stayed in hotel Husa Serrano Royal. This was one of the best hotels we stayed for far. We loved the customer service and convenient location of this hotel. Hotel Husa is located in the center of the city what makes everything nearby. It was a great surprise for us when we checked out at 5 am, and we were greeted with coffee and tea. Without a doubt we recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again”
Reviews.Author: Northern-Ontarions
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was good for walking to shopping and to get a taxi, some resturants in the area. If you like the High end shops this is the place to be. There is other more affordable shopping in the area also. This area is also a Tax Free Shopping Zone. The breakfast in the morning was good, they will make you anything you wish and the coffee is made when ordered. The front desk staff was very helpful, they do speak english. Most of them are helpful and knowledgeable about the attractions and shows to see. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cpsimons
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a lot of times at the Serrano Royal. Being half a block from Serrano it is a perfect base for visiting and shopping in Madrid. It has nice rooms with a lot of light - some bathrooms do not have a good ventilation - and prices are reasonable if you book in advance. The lobby is two flight of stairs from the street and there is no ramp. From the lobby the elevator serves all rooms. This is not a hotel for persons with mobility problems, but staff is there to help you with your baggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff!”
Reviews.Author: Moore_mat
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for a wedding in Spain and it was a great base for us. The rooms were well kept and all staff were polite and courteous. Reception staff are multi-lingual and the others are polite enough to help you stumble through your basic Spanish! :-). Breakfast is expensive, especially if you don't go inclusive, but you can easily fill up on a continental with muffins, pastries, cereal and fruit. There is a limited cooked breakfast (scrambled or fried eggs, bacon or frankfurters and that's pretty much it). A surprisingly small venue (only about 30 odd rooms in total). in the room the Walls aren't exactly thick but the room was arranged well (although you do get the continental version of a double room - two singles pushed together!). A good location right off the main cerra Serrano (the high street with all the expensive jewellery and clothes shops) and about 15 minutes walk from the main Madrid park a must-stop place to walk and relax!

Reviews.Title: “excellent, but watch the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: diomedea_exulans
Reviews.Content: Madrid is a difficult place to find a decent hotel in. We stayed for a weekend at the Husa Serrano, booked in advance and got a good price. The hotel is very well situated, central, quiet, and convenient for the main shopping streets and for the metro. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, with good beds, bathrooms and lighting. Staff are courteous and considerate. We had an excellent visit. Two reservations. If you have a car (though we did not), parking is not easy. And the breakfasts are very expensive and rather scrappy, and you will not be warned that they are not included in the rate: they increased our costs by about 30%!

Reviews.Title: “If less than 110 Euros, a great deal for this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: G_Explorer
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Hotels for this hotel - 75 Euros. It's a 3.5 to a 4 star hotel. It's elegant, clean and provides great service. The area is safe. The staff are very helpful, welcoming and friendly. The rooms are large, great furniture, classy and clean. The subway "Ruben Dario" is about 5 minutes away. The buses and taxis are easily accessible too. Cortes Ingles, which is a main department store with a supermarket, is right around the corner. The neighbourhood is upscale. It's like the Rodeo Drive of Madrid. You have your Gucci, Louis Vutton, Armani stores around the corner. There are cafes around the area for breakfast/snacks. Taxi to Puerta Del Sol, which is the centre of main attractions is about 8 Euros and 10 minutes away. There is an elevator and luggage storage at this hotel. The best night club in town is El Kapital. It has 7 floors of all kinds of music playing. It's worth the 15-20 Euros cover charge at this night club. Dress up though. All the good looking tourists and people in Madrid go here!!! Had a blast in Madrid and a great stay at this hotel. If the price is right, I would stay here again!!!
